ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Above them is a sealed vault of Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The Fire will vault them over.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Upon them shall be a Fire that will hem them in.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: who will be engulfed in the fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Upon them is a fire, in which they are imprisoned, closed and shut above them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: On them is fire closed over.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: over them is a Fire covered down.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Fire will be an awning over them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and the Fire will close in on them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Over them shall be Fire closing round.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: A closed Fire will be [imposed] upon them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: On them will be Fire vaulted over (all round).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The Fire will be shut over them (i.e. they will be enveloped by the Fire without any opening or window or outlet.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: with the Fire closed above them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Upon them is a padlocked Fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Over them will be fire closed in.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [90:20] Over them will be an enclosing Fire (read mu’sada or mūsada), closed on top [of them].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Fire will be an awning over them) the Fire will fall on them'. And of the surah in which the Sun is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 15 verses, 54 words and 247 letters: Surah 91: The Sun (al-Shams) And of the surah in which the Sun is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 15 verses, 54 words and 247 letters:
